text: Hi All, new to the CLI system having used the FTP to load batch files to our file manager can anyone walk me through how I can use this to upload files, I've had a few attempts with no success...yet

If you’re interested in seeing custom fonts be supported in the font field. I’d suggest creating a creating an idea in the idea forum <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/idb-p/HubSpot_Ideas>

This gets used to track demand and can influence prioritization of updates

Hey all! I am working on a CMS landing page. I already have a theme and project setup via the web UI. I need to make some adjustments to the theme. So I installed the cli. But the docs only show you ways to start a project from the cli. Is there a way to connect an existing project to the local dev env? Thank you.
you can download it via the fetch command

sure. create a local directory for your configuration and a subdirectory for your project, run hs init in the configuration directory, connect with your key, and then fetch your project into the subdirectory
you can fetch the entire design manager, or as many specific directories as you want.
you can then source-code-control those subdirectories if you want, without including your .yaml file with access credentials.
Hey James, I’d say start here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli#upload>

The `upload` command is how you push files into HubSpot, and the `filemanager` subcommand is how you’re specify that the `src` directory should be uploaded to the file manager, instead of the design manager

Hello all, 
I am currently utilizing the "Martech" theme for my new website. I have gone into global settings and changed my colors, fonts, etc. However, I want to be able to have the website menu stay visual on the page as I scroll down. How do I accomplish this or what snidbit of code can I apply to this page for that function to happen. I also want to be able to remove the green hover color on the top bar navigation. 
 
Please help Thank you in advance.
